name: Outgoing
tips: Build rapport, before getting to the point; Use humour, tell stories and use passionate, lively language; Avoid serious, business-like language
Focus on the value-adds (USPs) of your product, instead going too much into detail; Highlight customers using your product; Don't focus too much on risks or downsides
Ask about the prospect’s opinion and feelings and help the prospect to get his colleagues on board

name: Analytical
tips: Get right to the point; avoid small talk and use a precise, unemotional & serious language
Mention flaws before the prospect does and ask about current pain-points
Explain your product very detailed, provide as much data as possible and use reliable evidence

name: Harmonic
tips: Build rapport, before getting to the point; Use a warm and friendly language; Don't speak too quickly, or be demanding or pushy
Explain your product detailed; Highlight credentials, experiences and the stability/security of your product
Ask about the prospect’s concerns and help the prospect to get his colleagues on board

name: Dominant
tips: Get right to the point; avoid small talk and use a serious, confident & energetic language
Only use the time you need, don’t overrun the scheduled time
Highlight the competitive advantages and value-adds (USPs) of your product, instead going too much into detail
